abstract: Federal Judge Helen G Berrigan denies motion by Robert A Durst to suppress evidence in Los Angeles murder case; Durst's lawyers had argued that gun found in New Orleans hotel room was obtained by police without warrant; ruling brings Durst one step closer to being extradited from New Orleans to Los Angeles for arraignment.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Durst, who still must respond to murder charges in Los Angeles, had sought to suppress evidence recovered in his hotel room in New Orleans that led to a weapon charge.

headline.main: Robert Durst’s Effort to Dismiss Gun Evidence in Louisiana Case Is Rejected
headline.print_headline: Judge Denies Durst’s Bid to Dismiss Gun Evidence

snippet: Mr. Durst, who still must respond to murder charges in Los Angeles, had sought to suppress evidence recovered in his hotel room in New Orleans that led to a weapon charge.
